pr_title: HBASE-23205 Correctly update the position of WALs currently being replicated

timeline.message: HBASE-23205 Correctly update the position of WALs currently being replicated

timeline.bodyText: Are the workerThreads sorted so we get last logged first?
timeline.author: saintstack

replies.bodyText: Not sorted, It's only for testing in non-multi wal environment, as same as ReplicationSource.getCurrentPath().
replies.author: JeongDaeKim

timeline.bodyText: This is not for test, right? We iterate the workers twice -- once to get path and then again to get position. Don't want to return a Pair with Path and offset so just iterate once?
timeline.author: saintstack

replies.bodyText: Hmm... reading later in the patch, I see need to have them distinct. For sure we'll get the right offset for the selected path?
replies.author: saintstack

replies.bodyText: Yes, not for test and not the same one. each thread have it's own path and position. no need to iterate
replies.author: JeongDaeKim

timeline.bodyText: Will we be doing a bunch of spinning updating same value over and over w/o these checks in place that look to see if position has changed? Will we be burning CPU to no end?
timeline.author: saintstack

replies.bodyText: It won't be updated with the same value repeatably. entryReader will put a batch only when read position is changed.
replies.author: JeongDaeKim

timeline.bodyText: Its ok to remove this setting?
timeline.author: saintstack

replies.bodyText: We don't do pending flag anymore?
replies.author: saintstack

replies.bodyText: Yes, we don't need the flag anymore. it was required because not only shipper but also reader thread can update log position, but it had some issues about concurrency and high update frequency. With this PR, when wal rolled or log position changed, reader will put a batch for shipper to update log position.
replies.author: JeongDaeKim
